title: Sudtipos :: October releases
content:
Submitted by [Ale Paul](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/typophile.com/user/827 "View user profile.") : 6.Oct.2009 8.54am 

[Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/www.sudtipos.com/) is proud to announce the release of two really different new fonts. [Ricotta](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000502#specimen), a fresh new ingredient for your packaging designs and [Cascabel](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/cascabel/), a modular modern font with multiples alternates.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typophilericotta_6206.jpg)

About [Ricotta](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000502#specimen)  
Another unmistakable Koziupa/Paul production, Ricotta has very little baby fat for a sturdy brush script. What movement it shows is effective and integral to its expression, which is at once compact, lush and eye-catching. Ricotta, and its subtle details in just the right places, should feel at home among the bright and cheerful colors of dairy product and pizza packaging.

About [Cascabel](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103135850/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/cascabel/)  
Cascabel was built on a modular harmony and creates visibly maze-like geometric structures. When typeset in complete words, it conveys an unmistakable architectural approach to a design project. Ideal for magazines, posters or flyers, Cascabel is an alphabet functionally defined by a concept similar to that of building blocks. Designed By Ariel Di Lisio and digitized by Ale Paul.
author: Ale Paul
